basics.name: Rei Fukuzawa
basics.label: Computer Science Student | Web & Data Enthusiast
basics.summary: I am pursuing a B.A. in Computer Science at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa with a strong interest in software engineering, developer relations, and digital storytelling. I plan to study abroad at Chuo University in Fall 2025 and expect to graduate in Spring 2026.

courses: ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I
ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II

highlights: Consistently prepared high-quality yakitori dishes, boosting customer satisfaction.
Managed grill station efficiently during peak hours, ensuring timely service and food quality.
Maintained a clean and organized workspace, adhering to food safety and hygiene standards.
Welcomed and seated guests in an upscale yakiniku dining experience, ensuring a seamless and memorable first impression.
Managed reservations, waitlists, and table assignments to optimize guest flow and maintain a smooth dining experience.
Provided exceptional customer service by addressing guest inquiries, explaining menu offerings, and accommodating special requests.

volunteer.summary: Supported community events and rituals, assisting with setup, coordination, and ensuring smooth operations for temple visitors.

awards.title: Thomas E. Nichols and Debra S. Nichols Endowed Scholarship
